Definition: In this task, you're given a text. You need to indicate whether the text is about a person or not. If the text is generally about a person, output "Yes". If the text is not about a person, output "No". Pay attention that mere mentions of people in the text don't necessarily mean the text is about a person.

Positive Examples.input: Text:  The third and current HMS Argyll is a Type 23 'Duke' Class frigate. She is currently the oldest serving Type 23 frigate in the Royal Navy. Like all of her class she is named for a British dukedom in this case that of Argyll.
Positive Examples.explanation: HMS Argyll is a frigate which a warship. Clearly the text is not about a person. Hence, the answer is No.

Positive Examples.input: Text: Alison Bechdel (/ˈbɛkdəl/ BEK-dəl; born September 10 1960) is an American cartoonist. Originally best known for the long-running comic strip Dykes to Watch Out For she came to critical and commercial success in 2006 with her graphic memoir Fun Home.
Positive Examples.explanation: Alison Bechdel is an American cartoonist. Clearly the text is about a person. The answer should be Yes.

Negative Examples.input: Text:  The third and current HMS Argyll is a Type 23 'Duke' Class frigate. She is currently the oldest serving Type 23 frigate in the Royal Navy. Like all of her class she is named for a British dukedom in this case that of Argyll.
Negative Examples.explanation: HMS Argyll is a frigate which a warship. Clearly the text is not about a person. Hence, it is an incorrect answer and a negative example.

Negative Examples.input: Text: Alison Bechdel (/ˈbɛkdəl/ BEK-dəl; born September 10 1960) is an American cartoonist. Originally best known for the long-running comic strip Dykes to Watch Out For she came to critical and commercial success in 2006 with her graphic memoir Fun Home.
Negative Examples.explanation: The output is neither "Yes" nor "No". Hence, it is an incorrect answer and a negative example.

Instances.input: Text:  SMS Zieten was the first aviso built for the Imperial German Navy (Kaiserliche Marine). She was built in Britain in 1875–1876 and was the last major warship built for Germany by a foreign shipyard. Ordered as a testbed for the new Whitehead torpedo Zieten was armed with a pair of 38 cm (15 in) torpedo tubes and was capable of a top speed of 16 knots (30 km/h; 18 mph) making her the fastest ship in the German fleet at the time.

Text:  Fathabad (Persian: فتح اباد‎ also Romanized as Fatḩābād) is a village in Dastgerdan Rural District Dastgerdan District Tabas County South Khorasan Province Iran. At the 2006 census its population was 26 in 8 families.
Text:  Deep Soul (Greek: Ψυχή Βαθιά) is a 2009 Greek drama film directed by Pantelis Voulgaris on the 1946–49 Greek Civil War.

Text:  Benjamin Franklin Bailey (1875 – after 1944) was an eminent American electrical engineer. A native of Sheridan Michigan Benjamin Franklin Bailey studied electrical engineering at the University of Michigan and later held the positions of chief engineer of the Fairbanks Morse Electrical Manufacturing Company and Howell Electrical Motor Company director of Bailey Electrical Company and vice-president and director of the Fremont Motor Corporation.
Text:  Aleksandr Kislitsyn (Russian: Александр Кислицын; born 8 March 1986) is a Kazakhstan international football defender.

Text:  Geoffrey Page Geoff Shaw (born 12 October 1967) is an Australian politician representing the electoral district of Frankston for the Liberal Party of Australia from the 2010 Victorian State election. On the 6 March 2013 he resigned from the Parliamentary Liberal Party.

Text:  Ashok Dinda (Bengali: অশোক দিন্দা) is an Indian cricketer. He plays for Bengal and Pune Warriors India in the Indian Premier League. Earlier he played for Delhi Daredevils and Kolkata Knight Riders.

Text:  George William Croft (December 20 1846 – March 10 1904) was a U.S. Representative from South Carolina father of Theodore Gaillard Croft.Born in Newberry County South Carolina Croft attended the common schools in Greenville South Carolina. He entered the South Carolina Military Academy at Charleston in 1863.
